body.p:
CIRCUIT COURT.
THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY, Plaintiff,
AGAINST } Indictment for Assault & Battery
Thomas Ruth Defendant.
The Grand Jury of Owen county, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Thomas Ruth of the offense of Assault & Battery committed as follows, viz:

The said Thomas Ruth, in the county, circuit, and State aforesaid, on the 28th day of April, 1864, did unlawfully assault beat and bruise and then and then and there unlawfully shoot at Jeptha Estes with a loaded gun loaded with powder & Shot & did then and there unlawfully assault beat & bruise the wife & daughter of said Jeptha Estes to wit Cordelia Estes and Miss Frances Estes. they being then & there in the dwelling House of the said Jeptha Estes and under his control & protection. and the said Thomas Ruth did then and there unlawfully and in a violent & forcible manner bust open the door and enter the dwelling house of the said Jeptha Estes and set said dwelling house on fire without consuming said house and all this in the night time contrary to the statute in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

John L Scott
Commonwealth's Attorney for 8th Judicial District.
Witnesses for Commonwealth:
Jephta Estes
Corelia Estes
Miss Frances Estes
Salem Wiley
David Hoover
Sara Butler
Jesse ButlerA Copy
Attest W H Sandford ck

THE COMMONWEALTH
AGAINST
Thomas RuthINDICTMENT FOR
Assault & BatteryA TRUE BILL.
J F Hawkins Foreman.Filed May 5th 1864
We of the Jury find Thos Ruth guilty and assess the damages at Three Hundred and fifty Dollars-
